Author: crumbly-toast
Text: i just can't help laughing at it, it's just so...dorky lmao. you're spot on with it being 1980s futurist  and i agree, it's a great quality to be able to laugh at yourself. i think a tasteful amount of self depreciation is important, cuz it helps remind you that you're not perfect, and that's ok

Author: SemicolonButterfly
Text: Lol. I saw that truck on the tv at the gym today and just....wowww...the 1980s futurists must be so happy. You could practically photoshop that baby into the original BladeRunner.    I think being able to laugh at/with myself is really helpful. My therapist and I chuckle a lot during sessions and I enjoy that. It’s not malicious. More Douglas Adams-esque; laughing at the absurdity and using that as a tool to enjoy life more. (Body-wise, I call it my “jello booty” cuz it keeps me away from despair.)
